main.description: A planned economic flow which has not been committed to, which can lead to economic events (sometimes through commitments)

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an intent

action.description: Relates an intent to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

provider.description: The economic agent who would provide the economic event

receiver.description: The economic agent whom the intent is for

resourceClassifiedAs.description: References concepts in a common taxonomy for categorization

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action

availableQuantity.description: The total quantity of the offered resource available

hasBeginning.description: The planned beginning of the intent

hasEnd.description: The planned end of the intent

hasPointInTime.description: The planned date/time for the intent

due.description: The time something is expected to be complete

inputOf.description: Defines the process for which this intent is an input

outputOf.description: Defines the process for which this intent is an output

finished.description: The intent is complete or not

image.description: The URI to an image relevant to the intent

imageList.description: URI addresses to images relevant to the intent

agreedIn.description: Reference to an agreement which specifies the rules governing this intent

resourceConformsTo.description: The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource

atLocation.description: The place where an intent occurs. Usually mappable.

deletable.description: The intent can be safely deleted, has no dependent information

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning
